title: This Week In Techdirt History: July 23rd – 29th
description: Five Years Ago This week in 2018, a bad new bill sought to create a nationwide exception to subpoena and warrant requirements for cellphone location data, while a court in Canada was affirming that there’s still an expectation of privacy in devices being repaired by third parties, and FBI boss Chris Wray infamously called for […]

title: That Which Copyright Destroys, ‘Pirates’ Can Save
description: There’s an interesting post on TorrentFreak that concerns so-called “pirate” subtitles for films. It’s absurd that anyone could consider subtitles to be piracy in any way. They are a good example of how ordinary people can add value by generously helping others enjoy films and TV programs in languages they don’t understand. In no sense do “pirate” […]
